00047 // Globals to this file only
00048 static int vacuum;
00049 static struct termios vacuum_config;
00050 static struct timeval vac_timeout;
00051 static fd_set vac_ready;
00052 static const char vacuum_port[] = "/dev/ttyS0";
00053 static const resp_size = 256;
00054 static char resp[256];
00055 static int missed_reads;
00056 // Characters we will use
00057 static const char NUL = '\x00'; // For NULL terminated strings
00058 static const char ACK = '\x06'; // For acknowledging
00059 static const char NAK = '\x15'; // For something wrong
00060 static const char ENQ = '\x05'; // For asking for something
00061 static const char ETX = '\x03'; // For clearing input buffer (of gauge?)
00062 static const char LF  = '\n';   // New line
00063 static const char CR  = '\r';   // Carriage return.
00064 static const char EOM[] = "\n\r"; // End of message
00065 static const char INQ_MODE[] = "PR1\r\n";
00066 static const char CONT_MODE[] = "COM,1\r\n";
00067 static const char SETPNT_STAT[] = "SPS\r\n";
00068 static const char SETPNT_1[] = "SP1\r\n";
00069 static const char SETPNT_2[] = "SP2\r\n";

00137 /*-- Frontend Init -------------------------------------------------*/
00138 
00139 INT frontend_init() {
00140   int ret, err;
00141   cm_get_experiment_database(&hDB, NULL);
00142 
00143   // Open serial port for vacuum
00144   vacuum = open(vacuum_port, O_RDWR | O_NOCTTY);
00145   printf("Opening vacuum gauge port...");
00146   if (vacuum < 0) {
00147     err = errno;
00148     printf("failed!\n");
00149     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00150            "Error opening vacuum gauge (errno %d)", err);
00151     return FE_ERR_HW;
00152   }
00153   printf("done.\n");
00154   printf("Getting current serial port attributes...");
00155   ret = tcgetattr(vacuum, &vacuum_config);
00156   if (ret < 0) {
00157     err = errno;
00158     printf("failed!\n");
00159     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00160            "Error getting vacuum gauge serial port attributes (errno %d)", err);
00161     return FE_ERR_HW;
00162   }
00163   printf("done.\n");
00164 
00165   /**********************************************************/
00166   /*** Serial Modes ***/
00167   /* Disable everything */
00168   vacuum_config.c_iflag &= ~(BRKINT | ICRNL | IGNBRK | IGNCR |
00169                              IGNPAR | INLCR | INPCK | ISTRIP |
00170                              IUCLC  | IXANY | IXOFF | IXON   |
00171                              PARMRK);
00172   vacuum_config.c_oflag &= ~(OPOST);
00173   vacuum_config.c_cflag &= ~(CLOCAL | CREAD  | CSIZE | CSTOPB |
00174                              HUPCL  | PARENB | PARODD);
00175   vacuum_config.c_lflag &= ~(ECHO   | ECHOE  | ECHOK | ECHONL |
00176                              ICANON | IEXTEN | ISIG  | NOFLSH |
00177                              TOSTOP | XCASE);
00178   /* Input */
00179   // Nothing.
00180   /* Output */
00181   // Nothing.
00182   /* Local */
00183   vacuum_config.c_cflag |= CLOCAL;        // Do not become owner of device?
00184   vacuum_config.c_cflag |= CREAD;         // Enable reading
00185   vacuum_config.c_cflag |= (CSIZE & CS8); // 8-bit bytes
00186   cfsetispeed(&vacuum_config, B9600);     // Default baudrate for vacuum is 9600
00187   cfsetospeed(&vacuum_config, B9600);     // Default baudrate for vacuum is 9600
00188   /* Control */
00189   vacuum_config.c_cc[VTIME] = 10;         // Interbyte timeout of 1 sec
00190   vacuum_config.c_cc[VMIN]  = 28;         // Longest msg is 2 measurements, 28 chars
00191   /*** Timeout ***/
00192   vac_timeout.tv_sec = 1;                 // Timeout to check if buffer is ready to read is 1 sec
00193   vac_timeout.tv_usec = 0;                // And 0 microseconds
00194   /**********************************************************/
00195 
00196   // Apply the attributes
00197   printf("Setting new serial port attributes...");
00198   ret = tcsetattr(vacuum, TCSAFLUSH, &vacuum_config); // Flush the output, discard input, and apply changes
00199   if (ret < 0) {
00200     err = errno;
00201     printf("failed!\n");
00202     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00203            "Error setting vacuum gauge serial port attributes (errno %d)", err);
00204     return FE_ERR_HW;
00205   }
00206   printf("done.\n");
00207 
00208   // Tell the vacuum gauge to await an inquiry
00209   printf("Setting vacuum gauge to measurement request mode...");
00210   ret = write(vacuum, INQ_MODE, sizeof(INQ_MODE)-1);
00211   if (ret < 0) {
00212     err = errno;
00213     printf("failed!\n");
00214     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00215            "Error writing to vacuum gauge to set inquire mode (errno %d)", errno);
00216     return FE_ERR_HW;
00217   }
00218   printf("done.\n");
00219   printf("Checking vacuum acknowledgement...");
00220 
00221   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00222   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00223   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);  
00224   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00225     printf("failed!\n");
00226     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00227            "Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (nothing received)");
00228     return FE_ERR_HW;
00229   }
00230   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 3);
00231   if (ret < 0) {
00232     err = errno;
00233     printf("failed!\n");
00234     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00235            "Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (errno %d)", errno);
00236     return FE_ERR_HW;
00237   } else if (resp[0] != ACK) {
00238     err = errno;
00239     printf("failed!\n");
00240     cm_msg(MERROR, "vacuum_gauge_init",
00241            "Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (something other than ACK received)");
00242     return FE_ERR_HW;
00243   }
00244   printf("done.\n");
00245 
00246   missed_reads = 0;
00247 
00248   return CM_SUCCESS;
00249 }

00294 
00295 INT vacuum_gauge_read(char *pevent, INT off) {
00296 
00297   // Work variables
00298   static int    i;                   // Looping
00299   static int    ret,           err;  // Error reporting
00300   static INT    stat;                // Temperaroy status holder for print statements
00301   // All of the numbers we're measuring
00302   static INT   *status;              // Status of gauge
00303   static BOOL  *sp1,          *sp2;  // Set points on or off
00304   static float *sp1l,         *sp1h; // First set point lower and upper trigger
00305   static float *sp2l,         *sp2h; // Second set point lower and upper trigger
00306   static float *pres;                // Pressure reading
00307   // And their corresponding strings (with terminating NULL)
00308   // Status:         1 character
00309   // Measurements:  10 characters
00310   static char  status_str[1+1];
00311   static char  sp1_str[1+1],   sp2_str[1+1];
00312   static char  sp1l_str[10+1], sp1h_str[10+1];
00313   static char  sp2l_str[10+1], sp2h_str[10+1];
00314   static char  pres_str[10+1];
00315   // Null terminate for conversion to numbers
00316   status_str[1] = NUL;
00317   sp1_str[1] = NUL; sp2_str[1] = NUL;
00318   sp1l_str[10] = NUL; sp1h_str[10] = NUL;
00319   sp2l_str[10] = NUL; sp2h_str[10] = NUL;
00320   pres_str[10] = NUL;
00321 
00322   // Keep track of erroneous calls to this function. Reset at end.
00323   missed_reads++;
00324 
00325   /*** Get status of set points ***/
00326   // Set mode (status)
00327   ret = write(vacuum, SETPNT_STAT, sizeof(SETPNT_STAT)-1);
00328   if (ret < 0) {
00329     err = errno;
00330     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to enable set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00331     return 0;
00332   }
00333   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00334   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00335   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00336   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00337     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (nothing received)\n");
00338     return 0;
00339   }
00340   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 3);
00341   if (ret < 0) {
00342     err = errno;
00343     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00344     return 0;
00345   } else if (resp[0] != ACK) {
00346     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (something other than ACK received)\n");
00347     return 0;
00348   }
00349   // Request set points
00350   ret = write(vacuum, &ENQ, sizeof(ENQ));
00351   if (ret < 0){
00352     err = errno;
00353     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to request status of set points (errno %d)\n", err);
00354     return 0;
00355   }
00356   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00357   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00358   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00359   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00360     printf("Vacuum gauge did not send status of set points.\n");
00361     return 0;
00362   }
00363   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 9);
00364   if (ret < 0) {
00365     err = errno;
00366     printf("Error reading status of set points from vacuum gaige (errno %d)\n", err);
00367     return 0;
00368   } else if (ret != 9) {
00369     printf("Received incorrect response size (expected 9, received %d)", ret);
00370     return 0;
00371   }
00372   // Record status
00373   sp1_str[0] = resp[0];
00374   sp2_str[0] = resp[2];
00375 
00376   /*** Get set point values ***/
00377   /* SP1 */
00378   // Set mode
00379   ret = write(vacuum, SETPNT_1, sizeof(SETPNT_1)-1);
00380   if (ret < 0) {
00381     err = errno;
00382     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to enable set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00383     return 0;
00384   }
00385   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00386   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00387   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00388   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00389     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (nothing received)\n");
00390     return 0;
00391   }
00392   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 3);
00393   if (ret < 0) {
00394     err = errno;
00395     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00396     return 0;
00397   } else if (resp[0] != ACK) {
00398     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (something other than ACK received)\n");
00399     return 0;
00400   }
00401   // Request set points
00402   ret = write(vacuum, &ENQ, sizeof(ENQ));
00403   if (ret < 0){
00404     err = errno;
00405     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to request status of set points (errno %d)\n", err);
00406     return 0;
00407   }
00408   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00409   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00410   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00411   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00412     printf("Vacuum gauge did not send status of set points.\n");
00413     return 0;
00414   }
00415   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 25);
00416   if (ret < 0) {
00417     err = errno;
00418     printf("Error reading status of set points from vacuum gaige (errno %d)\n", err);
00419     return 0;
00420   } else if (ret != 9) {
00421     printf("Received incorrect response size (expected 25, received %d)\n", ret);
00422     return 0;
00423   }
00424   if (resp[0] != '1') {
00425     printf("Received incorrect set point value (expect 1, received %c)\n", resp[0]);
00426     return 0;
00427   }
00428   for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00429     sp1l_str[i] = resp[i + 2];
00430     sp1h_str[i] = resp[i + 13];
00431   }
00432   /* SP2 */
00433   // Set mode
00434   ret = write(vacuum, SETPNT_2, sizeof(SETPNT_2)-1);
00435   if (ret < 0) {
00436     err = errno;
00437     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to enable set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00438     return 0;
00439   }
00440   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00441   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00442   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00443   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00444     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (nothing received)\n");
00445     return 0;
00446   }
00447   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 3);
00448   if (ret < 0) {
00449     err = errno;
00450     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00451     return 0;
00452   } else if (resp[0] != ACK) {
00453     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge set point request mode (something other than ACK received)\n");
00454     return 0;
00455   }
00456   // Request set points
00457   ret = write(vacuum, &ENQ, sizeof(ENQ));
00458   if (ret < 0){
00459     err = errno;
00460     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to request status of set points (errno %d)\n", err);
00461     return 0;
00462   }
00463   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00464   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00465   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00466   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00467     printf("Vacuum gauge did not send status of set points.\n");
00468     return 0;
00469   }
00470   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 25);
00471   if (ret < 0) {
00472     err = errno;
00473     printf("Error reading status of set points from vacuum gaige (errno %d)\n", err);
00474     return 0;
00475   } else if (ret != 9) {
00476     printf("Received incorrect response size (expected 25, received %d)\n", ret);
00477     return 0;
00478   }
00479   if (resp[0] != '2') {
00480     printf("Received incorrect set point value (expect 2, received %c)\n", resp[0]);
00481     return 0;
00482   }
00483   for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00484     sp2l_str[i] = resp[i + 2];
00485     sp2h_str[i] = resp[i + 13];
00486   }
00487   
00488   /*** Get pressure and status of gauge ***/
00489   // Set mode
00490   ret = write(vacuum, INQ_MODE, sizeof(INQ_MODE)-1);
00491   if (ret < 0) {
00492     err = errno;
00493     printf("Error writing to vacuum gauge to set inquire mode (errno %d)\n", err);
00494     return 0;
00495   }
00496   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00497   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00498   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);  
00499   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00500     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (nothing received)\n");
00501     return 0;
00502   }
00503   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 3);
00504   if (ret < 0) {
00505     err = errno;
00506     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (errno %d)\n", errno);
00507     return 0;
00508   } else if (resp[0] != ACK) {
00509     err = errno;
00510     printf("Vacuum gauge did not acknowledge measurement request mode (something other than ACK received)\n");
00511     return 0;
00512   }  
00513   // Request pressure
00514   ret = write(vacuum, &ENQ, sizeof(ENQ));
00515   if (ret < 0) {
00516     printf("Cannot write to vacuum gauge to request measurement (errno %d)", errno);
00517     return 0;
00518   }
00519   FD_ZERO(&vac_ready);
00520   FD_SET(vacuum, &vac_ready);
00521   select(FD_SETSIZE, &vac_ready, NULL, NULL, &vac_timeout);
00522   if(!FD_ISSET(vacuum, &vac_ready)) {
00523     printf("Nothing to be read from vacuum gauge");
00524     return 0;
00525   }
00526   ret = read(vacuum, resp, 15);
00527   if (ret < 0) {
00528     printf("Cannot read from vacuum gauge to get requested reading (errno %d)", errno);
00529     return 0;
00530   } else if (ret != 15) {
00531     printf("Received incorrect size response (expected 15, received %d)", ret);
00532     return 0;
00533   }
00534   status_str[0] = resp[0];
00535   for (i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
00536     pres_str[i] = resp[i + 4];
00537   }
00538 
00539   // Record in banks
00540   bk_init(pevent);
00541   bk_create(pevent, "PRS0", TID_INT, &status);
00542   *status++ = atoi(status_str); stat = *status;
00543   bk_close(pevent, status);
00544   bk_create(pevent, "PRM0", TID_FLOAT, &pres);
00545   *pres++ =   atof(pres_str);
00546   bk_close(pevent, pres);
00547   bk_create(pevent, "SP1S", TID_BOOL, &sp1);
00548   *sp1++ =    atoi(sp1_str);
00549   bk_close(pevent, sp1);
00550   bk_create(pevent, "SP2S", TID_BOOL, &sp2);
00551   *sp2 =      atoi(sp2_str);
00552   bk_close(pevent, sp2);
00553   bk_create(pevent, "SP1L", TID_FLOAT, &sp1l);
00554   *sp1l =     atof(sp1l_str);
00555   bk_close(pevent, sp1l);
00556   bk_create(pevent, "SP1H", TID_FLOAT, &sp1h);  
00557   *sp1h =     atof(sp1h_str);
00558   bk_close(pevent, sp1h);
00559   bk_create(pevent, "SP2L", TID_FLOAT, &sp2l);
00560   *sp2l =     atof(sp2l_str);
00561   bk_close(pevent, sp2l);
00562   bk_create(pevent, "SP2H", TID_FLOAT, &sp2h);
00563   *sp2h =     atof(sp2h_str);
00564   bk_close(pevent, sp2h);
00565   
00566   // Report on bad status
00567   
00568   switch (stat) {
00569   case 0:                                                                break;
00570   case 1:  printf("Vacuum gauge under range.\n");                        break;
00571   case 2:  printf("Vacuum gauge over range.\n");                         break;
00572   case 3:  printf("Vacuum gauge error.\n");                              break;
00573   case 4:  printf("Vacuum gauge off.\n");                                break;
00574   case 5:  printf("Vacuum gauge not attached.\n");                       break;
00575   case 6:  printf("Vacuum gauge unidentifiable.\n");                     break;
00576   default: printf("Vacuum gauge unknown status (status %d)\n", *status); break;
00577   }
00578 
00579   // Had a succesful read.
00580   missed_reads = 0;
00581 
00582   return bk_size(pevent);
00583 }
